result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Take prescribed medications.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Williams

defendant.name: Williams, Jessie
defendant.address: PO Box 351, Waupun Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
Per KSD, def. is in prison and is ill and unable to travel.  Sentencing hearing on 12/2/15 at 11:00 rescheduled for 1/22/16 at 10:45.  All parties notified by email.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter states there may be discrepancies within the PSI pertaining to some convictions contributed to the DE that are not his convictions and states this DE is actually Demitrius Joseph William and not Jessie Williams.  Atty Lassiter states DE never brought these matters to the PSI writers attention and she will look into these matters with the agent.  Sentencing adj. to 12/2/15 at 11:00 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter states DE's actual name is Dimitrius Joseph Williams with a DOB of 12/12/83 and requests an adjournment to clear up some discrepancies regarding his accurate identify as well as his prior convictions.  Atty Trigg has no objection to an adjournment so these discrepancies can be looked into.  Sentencing adj. to 10/8/15 at 11:00 AM.
Sentencing adjourned to Friday, 8/14/15 at 9:00 AM.
Court has reviewed and approves request to adjourn sentencing w/ no objection by the DA's Office.
Email correspondence received from Atty Lassiter requesting Sentencing be pushed back as she received the PSI yesterday and needs to go over with DE.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Neither parties have received a PSI and request an adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.
940.203(2) - Battery or threat to Judge, repeater

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on bond and Court orders a $10,0000 Cash Bond on this file.
see minutes for Plea Hearing on 5-4-15

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Preliminary hearing is waived on the record.  Atty Lassiter acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint; reading is waived.  Case is resolved.  DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 6/19/15 at 10:00 AM.
